description: Adds the specified inbound (ingress) rules to a security group.

unverifiedMitreAttackTechniques.reason: By adding or modifying ingress rules, attackers can enable remote access to the EC2 instances, which is a direct use of the AuthorizeSecurityGroupIngress API call to allow external services.
Attackers can use the API call to allow inbound traffic, facilitating the transfer of tools or payloads directly into the compromised environment.
Modifying security group rules to disable defenses or monitoring directly involves the AuthorizeSecurityGroupIngress API call.
Discovering which permission groups can modify security group rules is directly relevant as it informs the attacker's strategy to use the AuthorizeSecurityGroupIngress API call.
Directly using the AWS API, including AuthorizeSecurityGroupIngress, is a method attackers employ to execute actions within the cloud environment.
If an attacker exploits a vulnerability and gains access to an AWS account, they might use the AuthorizeSecurityGroupIngress API call to further their attack by establishing ingress points.
Attackers might modify ingress rules to allow traffic through a proxy, enabling them to route malicious traffic through the compromised environment.
